name: The Haunted: Hells Reach
description: Winner of 2010′s Make Something Unreal contest, The Haunted: Hells Reach is a fast-paced horror game where your goal is to liberate cursed places and survive the assault of Hell.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista or Windows 7 Processor: Intel Pentium Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz or AMD Athlon X2 2.8GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Shader Model 3.0 graphics card with 256MB of memory (NVIDIA GeForce 7900GS, ATI Radeon 2000 series or higher) DirectX®: 9 Hard Drive: 4GB of free hard drive space Sound: DirectX compatible sound card

reviews.review_text: This game is a hidden gem and a masterpiece, it's probably the most underrated game ever. This game still has a lot of potential and i wish that something can be done to revive it and increase the popularity and amount of players.

It is a shame that there was so much hate for this game, because in my opinion it is beyond great. It's very simple, but insanely fun. You versus the demons of hell; a great combination. You and three others must tackle down the enemies wave by wave until you reach the depths of hell and fight a boss. It is a great challenge and an awesome time. My favorite aspect about this game is how awesome each melee strike and attack is. You have a surprisingly large amount of melee attacks and each will cause you to be showered in a pool of blood and limbs. But beyond that are the upgraded versions of your starting pistol, SMG, and shotgun. Oh, and the knife as well. Each new upgrade gets crazier, more powerful, and enhances the gore. And there is also a nice variety in maps, too. Each one feels different and will require a different setup plan. AS for bugs, well, I have not encountered any bugs. It runs really smoothly for me as well. To me it's pretty polished. It also looks beautiful. At its full price it is steep, seeing as how many don't play this game anymore, but if it's on sale I would highly recommend getting it.

Personally, I find this so much more fun than Killing Floor 2. Though the game is old, it still has decent graphics (Unreal Engine 3) and just has a good feel to the movement/guns. It reminds me a little of Serious Sam meets Killing Floor. I have not tried the Vs mode yet, but am enjoying the 'horde' mode. I like the fact that it is not just an endless horde mode (though it appears you can choose that if you like), but instead as a small form of progression to give you something to strive for.  At the current sale price ($2.24) it seems like an easy decision.

This game reminds me a little of Killing Floor, but in 3rd person.. it uses the unreal engine so it runs flawlessly. Hells Reach was released a couple years ago as a mod for unreal engine, this however includes more weapons, levels, etc. fun game if you like shooting zombies and demons while running around to scavenge for ammo and supplies.

This is the single best arena shooter and best zombie shooter (fps) I have played to date. Beats all of the competition by a mile.  Great looks, great feel (gun play, running, even enemy hits are not as annoying as in other games). Gives you options, weapon upgrades, additional unupgradeable weapons. Quite a few maps each with some special mechanic.  Sadly I came to the party late and it's not that easy to find people to play with.

It's a fun 3rd person shooter, it's getting on quite a bit though. It can be played single player but that's not particularly fun and it can get really hard.  So it's best to play with friends as the online community playing this game is almost none existant. Luckily you can easily play with your friends with the click of a few buttons, host a game, have them join and you'll be having mindless fun killing all the hellish enemies that attack you and try making the best score possible.  I had a blast playing this with friends so I recommend you try it too, find a few friends with this game and play it with them. I'd give it a 7/10 easily. I'd give it higher if the online community existed, but it's gone now.
